h2.a: Updates for the Week of April 20, 2020

span.style: color: #ff0000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;
span.strong: REQUIRED DISTANCE LEARNING STARTS MONDAY, APRIL 27.

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;
color: #ff0000; text-decoration: underline;
color: #000000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;
span.strong:
Student username and passwords, as well as log in instructions were US postal mailed to all students on Wednesday, April 22;
with expected delivery at home on Friday, April 24.

span.style: color: #000000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;
span.strong: Student usernames, passwords, and login instructions will also be emailed to all families at 3:00 pm on Friday, April 24.

span.style: color: #000000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;
span.strong: After receiving your log in information, if you are having difficulty logging in, watch the following video showing the steps on how to log in: https://bit.ly/3axNnVc

span.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;
color: #000000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;
span.strong: Starting on Monday, April 27, technical support will be available from 8:00 am to 3:00 pm, Monday through Friday at either of the following:

span.style: color: #000000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;

span.span: tarting Monday, April 27, all students in the Zillah School District will transition to REQUIRED distance learning.

span.style: color: #000000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;
span.strong: Families can expect to receive student login instructions and further information by both US Postal Mail and Email on or about Friday, April 24.

span.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;

strong.span: Resources from the Yakima Health District:

td.p: You can protect your health and the health of your family:

ul.li: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue when you cough or sneeze. Throw the tissue in the trash and wash your hands.
Clean and disinfect objects and surfaces.
Stay at home and away from others if you are sick.

td.p: We will continue to monitor through the Yakima Health District. If you would like information from their agency, please visit

span.style: color: #ff0000;
font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;
font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif;

strong.span: On Monday, April 6, 2020 Washington State Governor Jay Inslee and State Superintendent Chris Reykdal announced the closure of all Washington State schools through the remainder of this school year.

span.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;

span.span: However, this does not end the Zillah School District’s commitment to serving our students and our community.

span.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;
font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;

p.span: School district administration is currently developing plans to address several questions including:

span.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;

li.span: Ensuring that our high school seniors are given the support needed to meet graduation requirements and ultimately have the opportunity to earn their diploma.

span.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;

li.span: Continuing to provide meals to all children in our community throughout the closure.

span.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;

li.span: Establishing academic expectations for all preschool through 12th grade students for the remainder of the year – including both online and offline materials and supports.

span.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;

li.span: Creating clear communication pathways between students, teachers, parents, and support staff.

span.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;

li.span: Developing safe and clear protocols that allow parents and/or students to collect belongings still at school.

span.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;

p.span: While much of the work to address the above has been in the works for quite some time, Monday’s announcement comes with new rules and responsibilities for the district that will take additional time to respond to and implement.

span.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;

p.span: The Zillah School District will provide updates to all parents/guardians via email, social media, and with updates posted to www.zillahschools.org.

span.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;

p.span: If you have any immediate questions or concerns, please contact the district office at 509-829-5911.

span.style: font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;
color: #000000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;
span.strong: El lunes 6 de abril de 2020, el gobernador del estado de Washington Jay Inslee y el Superintendente estatal Chris Reykdal anunciaron el cierre de todas las escuelas del estado de Washington durante el resto de este año escolar.

span.style: color: #000000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;

p.span: Sin embargo, esto no termina el compromiso del Distrito Escolar de Zillah de servir a nuestros estudiantes y nuestra comunidad.

span.style: color: #000000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;

p.span: La administración del distrito escolar actualmente está desarrollando planes para responder varias preguntas que incluyen: Asegurar que nuestros estudiantes de último año de high school (secundaria) reciban el apoyo necesario para cumplir con los requisitos de graduación y, en última instancia, tengan la oportunidad de obtener su diploma. Continuaremos brindando los desayunos y almuerzos a todos los niños de nuestra comunidad durante el cierre.

span.style: color: #000000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;

p.span: Establecer expectativas académicas para todos los estudiantes, maestros, padres y personal de apoyo. Desarrollar protocolos seguros y claros que permitan a los padres y / o estudiantes recoger sus pertenencias aun en la escuela. Si

span.style: color: #000000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;

p.span: El anuncio del lunes viene con nuevas reglas y responsabilidades para el distrito que tomaran más tiempo para responder e implementar.

span.style: color: #000000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;

p.span: El Distrito Escolar de Zillah proporcionara actualizaciones a todos los padres por correo electrónico, redes sociales y con actualizaciones publicadas en www.zillahschools.org

span.style: color: #000000; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;

p.span: Si tiene alguna pregunta o inquietud inmediata, comuníquese con la oficina del distrito al 509-829-5911.

strong.span: Talking to your student about COVID-19 and school closures

span.style: color: #333333; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;

p.span: This is a stressful time for everyone, especially for students. Make yourself available to listen to their concerns and provide honest responses. These resources can provide further guidance:

strong.span: Hablar con su estudiante sobre COVID-19 y el cierre de las escuelas

span.style: color: #333333; font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;

p.span: Este es un momento estresante para todos. Especialmente para los estudiantes. Hágasele saber que es natural y está bien estar preocupado. Este disponible para escuchar sus inquietudes y brindar respuestas honestas. Estos recursos pueden proporcionar más orientación.

div.p: March 12, 2020
COVID-19 Zillah School District Notice

The Zillah School District, along with other SCAC league school districts, will be postponing all school-sponsored student events effective immediately through April 12, 2020 at which time we will re-evaluate the situation. This decision also suspends all student events hosted by Zillah schools where outside participants would be traveling into the community. This includes activities such as home and away athletic contests, student field trips outside of our community, concerts, and other program related events.

In addition, the Zillah School District is restricting the use of all facilities by outside entities/non-school related groups. Such entities include youth sport practices and games, religious club meetings, recreation group activities (Scouts), etc. until further notice.
Please keep in mind that the health and safety of our students, staff, and community is our priority when making such decisions.
Information regarding rescheduling of events and opening up facilities will be made available when conditions improve and/or are recommended by health experts.
Doug Burge
Superintendent
Zillah School District Patrons,

The Zillah School District is aware of the growing concerns with Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) that is impacting Washington State as well as globally. We are taking extra precautions by disinfecting high use areas and are educating staff and students on proper technique with hand-washing, coughing and sneezing etiquette, and communicating about staying home when ill. These are basic techniques that everyone should practice.
Here is an excerpt from the Yakima Health District:
You can protect your health and the health of your family:

ul.li: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue when you cough or sneeze. Throw the tissue in the trash and wash your hands.
Clean and disinfect objects and surfaces.
Stay at home and away from others if you are sick.

div.p: We will continue to monitor through the Yakima Health District. If you would like information from their agency, please visit https://www.yakimacounty.us/2323/Human-Coronavirus

span.style: font-family: Calibri, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

div.p: Zillah’s Hilton Elementary School was named on Thursday as one of the U.S. Dept. of Education’s elite group of National Blue Ribbon Schools for 2019.

Since the National Blue Ribbon Schools program started in 1982, only two schools in Yakima County have ever been chosen for this recognition. The first was Selah’s John Campbell Elementary School back in 1984-85, and the most recent came the following year to West Valley Junior High, for 1985-86.
Hilton Elementary is one of 362 schools in the nation that the U.S. Dept. of Education recognized with National Blue Ribbon School status for 2019.

The Zillah school is one of just four in the state of Washington to receive the Blue Ribbon recognition this year, and is the only elementary school among that statewide group. The other Washington schools on this year’s National Blue Ribbon list are Davenport High School, International School in Bellevue, and Northshore Christian Academy in Everett.

Hilton Elementary was recognized for the school’s work in the U.S. Dept. of Education’s performance category of Exemplary Achievement Gap Closing Schools, which acknowledges schools that are among their state’s highest performers in closing achievement gaps between various student groups and all students. The U.S. Dept. of Education also provides National Blue Ribbon status to schools in the category of Exemplary High Performing Schools, for schools that are among their state’s highest performers as measured by state assessments or nationally normed tests.

“Our Smarter Balanced test scores are far and above the state average,” said Hilton Elementary principal Ryne Phillips. “We have kids who just work hard, which is a reflection of the work of our staff. We have an amazing staff of educators who go above and beyond what’s expected of them for the students, and our students encounter this on a daily basis.”

Phillips added: “I’m happy for our teachers and our certified staff. This achievement is a building-wide effort. They’re highly motivated and it’s a reflection of all the work they’ve put in over the years. This building has been a leader in our district, and this is a great thing for Zillah’s schools.”

Zillah School District superintendent Doug Burge commented: “There are so many people who celebrate in this success – all levels of the staff here. Some of the initiatives we’ve put in during the last few years have really made a difference.”
Superintendent Burge said there will eventually be celebrations planned at the school and community level to recognize Hilton Elementary’s National Blue Ribbon achievement.

The U.S. Dept. of Education will be hosting its national award celebration activities during Nov. 14-15 in Washington, D.C. There, Harrah Elementary School will formally be presented its national award during a luncheon that will be held on Nov. 15.

U.S. Education Secretary Betsy DeVos congratulates this year’s National Blue Ribbon Schools in this video that is posted on YouTube (with the slide recognizing Zillah’s Hilton Elementary appearing at the 18:09 mark):

REPORTERS: Hilton Elementary School principal Ryne Phillips will be available for interviews at the school on Friday, Sept. 27, from 9:30 a.m. to 10:30 a.m. Please contact him directly for arranging your coverage with him at the school.

ESD 105 supports 25 public school districts and 23 state-approved private and tribal schools in South Central Washington. The agency serves the expressed needs of those schools in coordinating and conducting cooperative programs to benefit the approximately 66,000 K-12 students who are served in Kittitas and Yakima counties and portions of Grant and Klickitat counties. As one of nine ESDs in the state, ESD 105 carries out liaison activities between local school districts, the Washington State Office of Public Instruction, and the State Board of Education.

p.br: As Superintendents of the Zillah School District, it is our duty to be committed to the District’s Mission and Vision as Servant Leaders.

span.style: text-decoration: underline;

p.br: The Core Purpose of the District is to ensure high levels of learning for all students.

span.style: text-decoration: underline;

p.br: The Zillah School District, in partnership with students, parents and community, inspires a culture of life-long learning.
